name: A RANJITH
bio:
A Ranjith(Ph.D. Pursuing, NIT PATNA) is an active researcher in the areas of Machine Learning, Deep learning and Federated Learning. He received his M.Tech degree from the National Institute of Technology, Surathkal in the year 2016. He received his B.Tech degree in honors from JNTU Hyderabad.
He qualified the GATE examination multiple times (2012, 2013, 2014 and , 2016  and  2019), and the best rank achieved was  1403. Moreover, he qualified UGC NET in Computer Science in the year 2020.

tab_details.Research Interests: Federated Learning and Machine learning

name: Abhaya Kumar Sahoo
bio:
Dr. Abhaya Kumar Sahoo is currently working as an Associate Professor in School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Odisha. He has completed his B. Tech, M. Tech and Ph.D. from KIIT Deemed to be University in 2010, 2012 and 2021 respectively.
He has received Founder’s Gold Medal and Chancellor’s Gold Medal in M. Tech. He has 8 years teaching experience and 1 year industry experience. His favourite teaching subjects include big data, operating system, web technology, computer organization and database. His area of research includes data analytics, recommender system, data security and data mining. He has published more than 20 research papers in national and international conferences and journals. He guides undergraduate and post graduate students in different project. He has also published more than five book chapters in different reputed books. He is involved in different academic activities such as organizing committee member in international conferences, reviewers in international journals, keynote speaker in workshop and different accreditation activities. He has attended more than thirty different programs such as a faculty development program, seminar and workshop in national and international level. He was Odisha State Student Coordinator in Computer Society of India during 2019-20. He has achieved CSI Young IT Professional award in 2013 and Best Faculty award for good academic performance in 2013 and 2014. He is the life member of CSI, IAENG, CSTA and IET.

name: Abhijit Deuri
bio: Abhijit Deuri completed his MTech from IIT Guwahati, where he focused on "Reliability-Oriented Workflow Scheduling in Cloud Systems" for his thesis. His research interests encompass Cloud Computing, Edge Computing, Fog Computing and Image Processing.

tab_details.Research Interests: Cloud Computing

name: Abhishek Raj
bio:
I am an accomplished assistant professor specializing in the field of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) with a focus on Machine Learning , Hardware Security and Computer Architecture. With a strong academic background and expertise in cutting-edge technologies, I have made significant contributions to the field. I completed my Master of Technology (MTech) degree in CSE from the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur. During my graduate studies, I developed a keen interest in the intricate interplay between hardware security and architectural design, ML exploring ways to enhance the resilience of computer systems against potential vulnerabilities and attacks. 
Having excelled in my academic pursuits, I embarked on a teaching career as an assistant professor, leveraging my expertise to inspire and educate the next generation of engineers. I have a natural aptitude for explaining complex concepts in a clear and engaging manner, making the subject matter accessible to students with diverse backgrounds. Alongside my teaching responsibilities, I am actively involved in research activities, striving to advance knowledge in the field of Digital VLSI Design , RF antenna design , IoT devices,  hardware security and architecture. Furthermore, I actively collaborate with industry professionals and engage in consultancy work, bridging the gap between academia and real-world applications. This allows me to stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field and incorporate practical insights into my teaching and research endeavors. As an assistant professor, I am known for my dedication to fostering a dynamic and inclusive learning environment. I prioritize individual student growth, offering guidance and mentorship to help students explore their passions and develop their skills. My approachable nature and commitment to excellence have earned me the respect and admiration of both colleagues and students.In summary, I am a highly accomplished assistant professor specializing in CSE with a specialization in ML ,  Hardware Security and Computer Architecture. My academic achievements, teaching prowess, and research contributions make me an invaluable asset to my institution and the broader academic community.

tab_details.Research Interests: Machine Learning , Computer Architechure ,VLSI , Hardware Security

name: Abhishek Ray
bio:
Prof. (Dr.) Abhishek Ray
Professor & Dean (Industry Engagements)
With the quality of Novelty and Transparency a teacher who is a self motivated and loves of life as a teacher is to engage deeply with students to enhance their professional career. Over 25 years of experience in teaching, research & academic administration, out of which a successful 16+ years devoted specifically in the career augmentation, training and placement activities of a massive academic institution. 
During his 19+ years of association with KIIT, he had held various administrative positions in School of Computer Engineering from 2005 to 2020 in KIIT. He is currently serving as Dean (Industry Engagements) since 2020 at KIIT deemed to be University. 
Aim to consistently strive to create a challenging and engaging learning environment in which students become life-long scholars and learners. Dr. Abhishek Ray completed his Ph.D. (Computer Science & Engineering) from KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, M.E. (Computer Science & Engineering) from REC, Rourkela (currently renamed as NIT, Rourkela), Odisha, B.E. (Computer Science & Engineering) from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. 
His teaching & research areas of interest are Compiler Design, Automata Theory, Software Engineering, SOA, Software Testing, AI, Data Analytics, Cloud Computing, Machine Learning, BlockChain, Image Processing, IoT, etc. He had guided 4 Ph.D scholars and 20+ Master’s Dissertation and had published / presented more than 30 research articles in the international & national journals, conferences and seminars. 
He has been a member of various professional bodies like IET, ISTE, ISC. He has been awarded as Dynamic Professor of the year 2021 by Global Teaching Excellence Awards 2021.

tab_details.Research Interests: Compiler Design, Automata Theory, Software Engineering, SOA, Software Testing, AI, Data Analytics, Cloud Computing, Machine Learning, Blockchain, Image Processing, IoT, etc.

name: Abinas Panda
bio: Abinas Panda currently serves as an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Engineering. He is pursuing his Doctoral course at the National Institute of Technology, Rourkela. He has completed his Master’s Degree from the Department of Computer Science & Engineering VSSUT Burla in 2014. He has a total of 4+ years of teaching experience in several organizations in India. Apart from teaching he is a  member of the IEEE . His research interest include Software-defined Networks, Machine learning, Wireless Networks, and Algorithms.

tab_details.Research Interests: Software Defined Networking,Wireless Network

name: Abir Sen
bio: I have excellent educational qualifications. I have a strong academic background, having completed my B.Tech (2011-2015) from NIT Durgapur and M.Tech (2015-2017) from NIT Meghalaya. I have completed my PhD from NIT Rourkela in 2024. My areas of interest include optimization of deep learning-based models, computer vision, biomedical image processing, hand gesture recognition system and HCI. To date, I have authored four papers (Q1 and Q2) published in SCI-indexed journals (Springer), with another journal article (SCI) currently under review. I am deeply committed to advancing research and contributing to innovative solutions in my areas of expertise.

name: Ajay Anand
bio:
"He completed his B.Tech. In Mechanical Engineering from IIT Madras in 2003 and M.S. from State University of New York in 2006 after which he worked as Software Engineer in Game Development and Virtual Reality Systems before returning to India in 2010 to pursue a career in Academia.
He has over 4 years of industry experience and over 5 years of experience teaching applied as well as foundational Computer Science courses. His research interests include application of mathematical statistics, applied deep learning algorithms and general machine learning algorithms in the field of computer graphics and image processing."

tab_details.Research Interests: Machine Learning, Computer Graphics, Machine Vision

name: Ajay Kumar jena
bio: Dr. Ajay Kumar Jena is working as Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University. He has obtained his Master degree in Computer Science and Engineering from BPUT, Rourkela and received his Ph. D. degree from KIIT Deemed to be University in 2015. He has contributed more than 30 papers in various journals and conferences of international repute. He has also contributed three book chapters in international published edited volumes. Dr. Jena has 14 years of experience in teaching to under graduate and post-graduate students of Computer Science and Engineering in different engineering colleges and 9 years of research experience. He has worked as Sr. Lecturer in College of Engineering, Bhubaneswar and Central Institute of Plastics Engineering and Technology (CIPET), Bhubaneswar from 2010 to 2013. He has edited two books for Springer international publication. He has served as Organizing Chair and Committee member of different International Conferences, Workshops, Symposium etc. He is associated with different international bodies as Editorial/Reviewer board member for various journals and conferences. He has already supervised seven master students and guiding three Ph. D. scholars. He is also associated with various educational and research societies like ISCA, CSI, IAENG etc. His research interest includes Software Testing, Machine Learning, Soft Computing, Data Mining, Bio-informatics etc.

He holds a Ph.D. and M.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT Kharagpur. His research interests include Machine Learning, Data Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence. Dr. Pasayat has published extensively in reputed international journals and conferences and is actively involved in interdisciplinary research projects. He also serves as a reviewer for leading journals and conferences, contributing to the advancement of computing technologies through both academic research and practical, real-world applications.

name: Aleena Swetapadma
bio: Aleena Swetapadma started her career as assistant professor in School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) University, Bhubaneswar, India from 2016. She did her school education (6th to 12th) with scholarship from Govt. of India in JNV, Cuttack, India. She did her B. Tech from CET, Bhubaneswar, India and M. Tech in computer technology from NIT, Raipur, India. She obtained her Ph. D from NIT, Raipur, India in the area of application of artificial intelligence in power system protection. She has been awarded with POSOCO Power System Award for her work of M.Tech thesis by power grid of India (PGCIL) INDIA in partnership with FITT, IIT, Delhi 2nd rank in India, with Rs. 30,000/- and Citation in 2014. She did her Ph.D from NIT, Raipur (2013-2016). She has been awarded with POSOCO Power System Award for her work of Ph.D thesis by power grid of India (PGCIL) INDIA, 9th rank in India, with Rs. 60,000/- and Citation in 2017. She has completed one research project funded by science and engineering board (SERB), India of 16.5Lakhs entitled “Intelligent Fault Distance Estimation Scheme for High Voltage AC and High Voltage DC Transmission Lines: A Comparative Study of Various Artificial Intelligent Techniques to Explore a Suitable Scheme”. She has published 30 SCI indexed research papers under publishers like IEEE transactions, Elsevier, Springer, IET, Taylor and Francis etc. She has filed 3 patents of her work on transmission line fault location under IPR, India. She has also published 35 conference papers, 6 book chapters and one book. She is also serving as reviewer of various IEEE transactions, Elsevier, Springer, IET, Taylor and Francis journals. Her field of interest includes power system protection, HVDC, FACTS, biomedical signal and image processing, data mining and artificial intelligence application.

name: Alok Kumar Jagadev
bio: Dr. Alok Kumar Jagadev is a Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University. He completed his M.Tech in Computer Science from Utkal University in 2001 and earned his Ph.D. in Wireless Adhoc Networks from Siksha ‘O’ Anusandhan University in 2011. He has published over 65 research papers in reputed international journals and conferences. In addition, he has contributed three book chapters in internationally published edited volumes and co-authored four textbooks in computer science. He has also edited three books for publishers like IGI Global and Springer. Dr. Jagadev has played an active role in organizing various international conferences and workshops. He has supervised more than twelve master's students and guided nine Ph.D. scholars. He holds three Indian patents and two international patents. His areas of research include Soft Computing, Data Mining, and Bioinformatics.

name: Ambika Prasad Mishra
bio: Dr. Ambika earned his PhD in Computational Neuroscience from Prestigious City University of Hong Kong (QS Rank 48) and did his postdoctoral studies from the department of Public health from the City University of Hongkong. He studied the role different statistical parameters of sound that brain is interested to capture for distinguishing different sounds in his PhD thesis " Natural sound statistics in auditory scene analysis" . He established different CNN based model to predict injuries in race course horses for the Jockey club of Hongkong. He was also associated with Biosignal (HK) as an ML engineer. He is also associated with different organisations as an ML consultant.He has many publications in peer reviewed journals to his credit. He is open to work and collaborate across disciplines that requires application of Machine Learning.

name: Amiya Ranjan Panda
bio:
Dr. Amiya Ranjan Panda  has seven years of research experience in DRDO and one year of teaching experience.
He received the B.Tech. degree in information technology from Biju Patnaik University of Technology, Rourkela, India, in 2009, and the M.Tech. degree in computer science and engineering from the Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneshwar, India, in 2012.  He received Ph.D. degree from Siksha “O” Anusandhan University, Bhubaneshwar in the year 2017 working in a real-time project “Design, development and implementation of Software Defined Radio based Flight Termination System” of DRDO, ITR, chandipur.
He has worked as JRF, SRF and RA in DRDO, ITR, Chandipur for more than 7 years. Then he has worked as Assistant Professor in Siksha ‘O’ Anusandhan University for 4 months and currently he is working as Assistant Professor in KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. 
His research interest is Machine learning, IOT, data acquisition system and Software Defined Radio. He has published 15 international journals. Two of the journals are published in IEEE Transaction of Industrial Informatics. One edited book has been accepted for publication in 2019.
He is expert in teaching Data Structure and algorithm, Database Management System (DBMS), Artificial Intelligence, Operating System, Compiler Design, Computer Network, Machine Learning etc.

name: Anjan Bandyopadhyay
bio:
Dr. Anjan Bandyopadhyay is an Associate Professor at the Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He earned his Ph.D. from NIT Durgapur, West Bengal, India, under the Visvesvaraya Ph.D. Fellowship scheme of the Ministry of Human Resource Development (MHRD), Government of India. He also holds an M.Tech in Information Security from the Department of Information Technology, NIT Durgapur. Dr. Bandyopadhyay’s broad research interests encompass Algorithmic Game Theory (Mechanism Design), Quantum Computing, Cloud and Fog Computing, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML), and Healthcare Informatics. He has published over 133 research papers in reputed Scopus- and SCIE-indexed journals and conferences and Published 5 authored books, and has received several Best Paper Awards in many conferences. He is currently supervising PhD and M.Tech Scholars in emerging areas of computer science. 
His current research focuses primarily on Algorithmic Game Theory and Quantum Computing and its interdisciplinary applications. Dr. Bandyopadhyay also actively serves as a reviewer for numerous international journals and conferences, further demonstrating his expertise and commitment to academic excellence.

name: Arup Abhinna Acharya
bio: Dr. Arup Abhinna Acharya is an Associate Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar,Odisha, India. He received his Ph.D degree from KIIT Deemed to be University Bhubaneswar in the year 2016. He worked on the title “ Regression Testing of Object-Oriented Systems” under the supervision of Prof. (Dr.) Durga Prasad Mohapatra, National Institute of Technology, Rourkela.  In year 2002 , he received his B.Tech. (CSE) degree from Utkal University and in 2006 he received his M.Tech. (CSE) degree from KIIT Deemed to be University. His research areas include Object Oriented Systems, Software Testing, Software Cost Estimation, Security Testing, and Data mining. There are more than forty number of publications are there to his credit in many International and National level journal and proceedings. One student has been awarded Ph.D. degree under his supervision and currently two students are pursuing Ph.D. under his supervision. He is having seventeen years of experience in teaching undergraduate and postgraduate courses. Apart from teaching he holds many administrative positions in the University like the Program Head (Information Technology), Sr.Superintendent of Hostels to name a few. He is a member of ISTE and IET.

tab_details.Research Interests: Object Oriented SystemsSoftware TestingSoftware Cost EstimationSecurity Testing and Data mining
tab_details.Awards & Honours: Received the Best Teacher Award for the year 2013

name: Arup Sarkar
bio:
"Arup Sarkar, M.E, PhD(Pursuing), is an Assistant Professor of School of Computer Engineering. Before joining KIIT Deemed to be University,Arup Sarkar worked as an  Assistant Professor at DIT University, Dehradun. He also previously served as an Assistant Professor at Yamuna Institute of Engineering and Technology ,Yamunanagar,Haryana .He earned his Masters degree at BIT Mesra (2009) Ranchi and B.Tech degree at WBUT,Kolkata. Arup Sarkar also qualified in GATE exam. He joined KIIT School of Computer Engineering in 2015.
Arup Sarkar has authored several peer-reviewed publications. His research interests include Blockchain,Information Security,Wireless sensor network,Smart City. "

name: Ashish Singh
bio: Ashish Singh is working as an Assistant Professor, School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha-751024. He has completed his Ph. D. in Computer Science & Engineering from National Institute of Technology Patna (Bihar), under Visvesvaraya Ph.D. Scheme for Electronics & IT Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY) Government of India in 2020. He did his M.Tech from National Institute of Technology Patna, Bihar, (India) in 2015. His research areas are cloud security, trust management, access control, and network security.

name: Asif Uddin Khan
bio: Received Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar. Completed Ph.D. coursework from National Central University Taiwan, M.Tech in Computer Science & Engg from IIIT Bhubaneswar and B.Tech in Computer Science & Engg. from CV Raman College of Engineering Bhubaneswar. Presently working as a senior Asst Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University Bhubaneswar. My research interest includes designing improved models, frameworks and protocols for the modern networks and network based services to achieve guaranteed quality of service, improved quality of user experience and overall cost minimization. I am interested in emerging network technologies like vehicular ad-hoc networks, software defined networks, cloud computing, fog computing and edge computing. My current research focuses on Vehicular Fog Computing, Mobile Edge Computing and cloud-edge-fog (CEF) federation and IoT.

name: Banchhanidhi Dash
bio: Dr. Banchhanidhi Dash has completed his Ph.D. in CSE from KIIT, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He has more than 10 years of teaching and research experience  in the field of high performance computer architecture. Currently, he is working as an Assistant professor (II) in the school of Computer Engineering  in  KIIT, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He has also worked as an Assistant professor in the department of computer science & Engineering (CSE) in JIGJIGA University, Addis Ababa,  Ethiopia. He has published a many research papers in various International journals and conferences.

name: Bhabani Shankar Prasad Mishra
bio:
Bhabani Shankar Prasad Mishra was born in Talcher, Odisha, India in 1981. He received the B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering from Biju Pattanaik Technical University, Odisha in 2003,  M.Tech. degree in Computer Science and Engineering from the KIIT University, in 2003,  Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from F.M.University, Balasore,Odisha, India, in 2011 and Post Doc in 2013 from Soft Computing Laboratory, Yansei University, South Korea  .
Currently he is working as an Associate Professor at School of Computer Engineering, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. His research interest includes Pattern Reorganisation, Remote Sensing, Data Mining, Soft Computing, Big Data and Machine Learning. He has published more than 80 research articles in reputed Journal and Conferences, one patent and has edited more than five books of current importance. Under his guidance, 20 M.Tech and 2 PhD scholars are already been awarded. His h-index is 12.
Dr. Mishra was the recipient of the Gold Medal and Silver Medal during his M.Tech for the best Post Graduate in the University.

name: Bhaswati Sahoo
bio: Dr. Bhaswati Sahoo is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. With a decade of academic experience at KIIT, she has been instrumental in teaching core subjects such as Programming in C, Multimedia Applications, Compiler Design, Computer Networking and Database Management Systems. Dr. Sahoo holds a Doctrate Degree (Ph.D) in Computer science from Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha Master’s degree (M.Tech) in Computer Science and Engineering from Birla Institute of Technology, Mesra, and a Bachelor’s degree (B.Tech) from Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology, Burla. Her scholarly contributions include several publications in peer-reviewed international journals and conferences. Notably, she co-edited the book Strategies for E-Service, E-Governance, and Cybersecurity: Challenges and Solutions for Efficiency and Sustainability, published by Apple Academic Press and has published a good number of research paper in the field of computer science. Dr. Sahoo is an active member of professional bodies such as the Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET) and the National Science Congress. At KIIT, she has also undertaken administrative responsibilities, including serving as the Faculty-in-Charge (FIC) for Examinations and previously for Projects. Her dedication to teaching and research continues to contribute significantly to the academic community at KIIT and beyond.

name: Bindu Agarwalla
bio: Bindu Agarwalla has 15 years of teaching experience in University like Manipal, KIIT. Accomplished educator with demonstrated ability to teach, motivate, and direct students in the areas of Computer Science while maintaining high interest and achievement. Graduated in Computer Science and Engineering from State Govt College, (Jorhat Engineering College), M.Tech in Computer Science from IIT Guwahati and currently undergoing Ph,D from IIIT Guwahati is highly energetic and enthusiastic individual specialized in Computer Architecture, Compiler Design, Microprocessor, C and C++ Programming and dedicated to provide best in class education. Self-motivated,  profound  technical knowledge, strong planning, organizational and leadership skills and trilled to associated with KIIT university for more than 7 years. She has been the course coordinator for number of times, organizing member of International conference ICDCIT.

name: Biraja Prasad Nayak
bio: Dr. Biraja Prasad Nayak is currently working as an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He completed his Ph.D. from the National Institute of Technology Rourkela in 2025 and has contributed to the field of VANETs and Intelligent Transportation Systems. He received his M.Tech degree in Computer Science and Engineering from the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India, in 2017. His research interests include Vehicular Ad-hoc Networks, Wireless Sensor Networks, and Mobile Computing.

tab_details.Research Interests: VANETWireless Sensor NetworkMobile Computing

name: Biswajeet Sethi
bio: Dr. Biswajeet Sethi is currently serving as an Assistant Professor–II and Faculty-in- Charge of Website and Social Media Management in the School of Computer Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University. He earned his PhD from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at IIT Kharagpur. His primary research interests lie in Cloud Computing and Data Analytics, with a sustained secondary interest in Machine Learning. He brings over three years of industry experience from Infosys Ltd., where he served as a Senior Systems Engineer (SSE), and is a GBFS-certified Star Infosyon. During his doctoral tenure, he served as an NPTEL teaching assistant for the Cloud Computing course at IIT Kharagpur across six consecutive sessions and mentored NPTEL interns. In recognition of his student engagement, he was awarded the title “Faculty with Best Student Relation” and received a letter of appreciation for being among the top five faculty members with the best student feedback during his previous academic tenure. He is currently mentoring multiple interns in collaboration with professors from IIT Kharagpur, IIT Roorkee, IIT Bhubaneswar, and NIT Rourkela.

tab_details.Research Interests: Serverless Computing (Cloud Computing)

name: Chittaranjan Pradhan
bio: Dr. Chittaranjan Pradhan has obtained his Doctorate, Masters and Bachelor degrees in Computer Science & Engineering discipline. Currently, he is working as Associate Professor at School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. Pradhan has got a total of 16 years of Academic Teaching experience with more than 80 publications in reputed & peer reviewed Journals, Edited Books and Conferences of National and International repute. His research area includes Information Security, Image Processing, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Multimedia Systems etc. He also contributed as the Conference organizing committees, Journal/Conference Technical reviewer committee of many conferences and Journals. Dr. Pradhan has published few books published by publishers like Elsevier, IGI Global, LAP Lambert etc. He is also a member of various National and International Professional Societies in the field of Engineering & Research such as: IET, IACSIT, CSI, ISCA, IAENG, ISTE.

name: Dayal Kumar Behera
bio: Dr Dayal Kumar Behera, is working as an Asst. Professor (II) in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He is an enthusiastic, proactive faculty member and researcher with more than fifteen years of experience teaching courses at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels. Supervised many IEDC-funded projects, MTech theses, and BTech projects. He has two patents and published more than 20 research papers in various reputed, peer-reviewed refereed journals and international conferences. He earned a Ph.D. from KIIT University and an M.Tech. from Odisha University of Technology and Research (formerly the College of Engineering and Technology). He obtained a B.E. degree with honours in Information Technology from the National Institute of Science and Technology, Berhampur, Odisha. He coached his team to victory at the 2017 Cisco IoT Hackathon. Mentored the "Trithon 2019" programming hackathon, and his team finished second. His research interest includes Recommender System, Time Series Analysis, Remote Sensing, Internet of Things, and Computer Vision. He is a lifetime member of the ISTE, OITS and IAENG societies.

tab_details.Research Interests: Recommender System, Computer Vision, Time Series Forecasting, Remote Sensing, IoT
tab_details.Awards & Honours:
Certified Trainer for the role of "Telecom Terminal Equipment Application Developer (Android) QP No: TEL/Q2300" by TSSC, India.

SUN Certified JAVA Programmer for the JAVA 2 Platform 1.5 (SCJP 5.0) candidate ID-SR3086566.

Worked as a faculty coordinator and took classes at the Data Science Club, Trident Academy of Technology, Bhubaneswar. 

Completed CISCO Instructor Training and taught Introduction to IoT, Essentials of Python Programming, NDG Linux Essentials Courses at the CISCO Networking Support Center.

Participated in CISCO IoT Hackathon 2017 as a Mentor and the team grabbed the winner position.

Participated in the Programming Hackathon "Trithon 2019" as a mentor and the team earned runner-up position.

name: Debadatta Naik
bio: I have received the B.Tech degree from Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology, Burla (Formerly known as the University College of Engineering). I pursued the M.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering degree from the prestigious National Institute of Technology (NIT), Rourkela. I worked as a research scholar in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at the Indian Institute of Technology (ISM), Dhanbad. My research interests span across various domains, with a particular focus on Social Network Analysis, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Artificial Intelligence. My contributions in these areas aim to advance our understanding and application of computational methods in solving real-world problems, particularly in social networks and intelligent systems.

tab_details.Research Interests: My research interests span across various domains, with a particular focus on Social Network Analysis, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Artificial Intelligence. My contributions in these areas aim to advance our understanding and application of computational methods in solving real-world problems, particularly in social networks and intelligent systems.

name: Debanjan Pathak
bio: Debanjan Pathak received the B.tech (CSE) degree from Jalpaiguri Govt. Engg. College in 2014, M. Tech. (CSE) from IIT(ISM), Dhanbad in 2017. He is pursuing his Ph.D. (CSE) from NIT, Warangal. His area of research is Computer vision, Image Processing, and Deep Learning

name: Debashis Hati
bio: He got his Engineering degree( CSE) from Bangalore University , done his masters in CSE from R.E.C.(currently N.I.T.), Rourkela in the year 1997. At the beginning of his career, he spent 4 years in industry and continuing teaching for last 20 years. He taught several subjects like Computer Organization and Architecture, High Performance Computing, Microprocessors and Microcontrollers, Internet and Web Technology, programming languages like C, C++, Java. Now he is working in the research field of IoT and Machine learning.

name: Deependra Singh
bio: Deependra Singh is an Assistant Professor at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneswar). He holds a Bachelor’s degree from AITH Kanpur and later pursued his postgraduate studies at IIT Kharagpur, following an earlier stint at IIT Madras, where he explored advanced coursework in technology and research. A consistent performer, Deependra has cracked the GATE examination multiple times, showcasing his deep technical acumen. His academic interests lie in Machine Learning, Data Science, and their applications across industries. He is passionate about bridging the gap between academic theory and practical implementation, guiding students toward innovation and critical thinking.

tab_details.Research Interests: ML and Data science

name: Gananath Bhuyan
bio: Gananath Bhuyan has completed degree from Government college of Enginering Kalahandi, Bhawanipatna in the year 2013. He completed master's with Computer Science specialization from NIT Durgapur in the the year 2016. After post graduation he joined an MNC named Factset Software Solution Pvt. Ltd. and remained there for 1 year. Currently he is working in KIIT, deemed to be university since October 2017. He is also a member of IET.

tab_details.Research Interests: IoT, Software EngineeringMachine learning

name: Harish Kumar Patnaik
bio: Harish Kumar Patnaik is currently working as an Assistant Professor (II) in School of Computer Engineering, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar. He has received his M. Tech. degree in Computer Science from School of Math- Stat & Computer Science, Utkal University. Currently he is pursuing his Ph.D. from KIIT University in the area of Cloud Computing. He has total work experience of 20 years in teaching and industry. His area of interest includes Internet & Web Technology, Cloud Computing, Database Management System, Computer Architecture etc.

tab_details.Research Interests: Computer ScienceCloud Computing

name: Himadri Sekhar Roy
bio: Dr Himadri Sekhar Roy is an Assistant Professor (II) in the School of Computer Engineering at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), a Deemed-to-be University in Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He earned his PhD in Computer Science & Engineering from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, in 2025, with a focus on Big Data storage and retrieval in distributed environments. His research interests include Big Data, Distributed Storage and Processing, Cloud Computing, High-Speed Mobile Adhoc Networks (MANETs), IoT, and Open-Source Hardware. He has published multiple journal articles, conference papers, and book chapters. Dr Roy received fellowships from DRDO, Govt. of India, for a project on high-speed MANET development, and from UGC under the UPE Phase-II scheme for work on Big Data management in cloud environments. He holds an M.E. from Jadavpur University (2015) and a B.Tech from MAKAUT (2009). With extensive industry experience from 2009, he has worked in progressive web development, mobile apps, cloud platforms (AWS), microservices, e-commerce systems, and open-source technologies using PHP, Dot Net, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, Node.js, AngularJS, etc.

tab_details.Research Interests: Big DataDistributed storage and processingCloud computingHigh speed Mobile Adhoc networkIoTOpen source HardwareDistributed Computing

name: Himanshu Ranjan
bio: I am currently working as an Assistant Professor (Grade-I) at the School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneswar. I obtained my M.Tech  degree from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Patna. I have qualified the Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) twice with a 99 percentile score. My areas of expertise include Natural Language Processing (NLP), Deep Learning, and Data Structures and Algorithms. My M.Tech thesis focused on developing a Maithili-to-English translation system for low-resource languages. I have also worked on the design and implementation of a Learning Management System (LMS). My research interests primarily lie in the fields of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and language technology. Furthermore, I actively collaborate with industry professionals and engage in consultancy work, bridging the gap between academia and real-world applications. This allows me to stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field and incorporate practical insights into my teaching and research endeavours. As an assistant professor, I am known for my dedication to fostering a dynamic and inclusive learning environment. I prioritize individual student growth, offering guidance and mentorship to help students explore their passions and develop their skills. My approachable nature and commitment to excellence have earned me the respect and admiration of both colleagues and students. In summary, I am a highly accomplished assistant professor specializing in CSE with a specialization in ML  and field of nlp. My academic achievements, teaching prowess, and research contributions make me an invaluable asset to my institution and the broader academic community.

tab_details.Research Interests: NATURAL LANGUAGE PROCESSING

name: Himansu Das
bio: Dr. Himansu Das, works as Associate Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. He has received Ph.D. in Engineering degree from Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology (VSSUT), Odisha. He has received M.Tech degree in Computer Science and Engineering from the National Institute of Science and Technology, Odisha. He has also received B.Tech degree from the Institute of Technical Education and Research, Odisha, India. He has published several research papers in various international journals and has presented at conferences. He has also edited several books published by IGI Global, Springer, CRC press, and Elsevier. He has also served on many journals and conferences as editorial or reviewer board member. He is proficient in the field of Computer Science Engineering and served as an organizing chair, a publicity chair and acted as a member of the technical program committees of many national and international conferences. His research interests include the field of Data Mining, Soft Computing, and Machine Learning. He has also more than seventeen years of teaching and research experience in various engineering colleges and universities.

name: Hitesh Mohapatra
bio: Dr.Hitesh Mohapatra is an Associate Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, in Odisha, India. He holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science & Engineering from Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology, with a focus on designing fault-tolerant models for wireless sensor networks integrated with smart city applications. His academic journey includes a Bachelor's degree in Information Technology from Biju Patnaik University of Technology and a Master's degree in Computer Science & Engineering from Odisha University of Technology and Research. Dr. Mohapatra has over 15 years of experience in both academia and industry, contributing significantly to research in areas such as IoT, wireless sensor networks, fault tolerance, and smart city applications. His research has been published in various high-impact journals and conferences, with citations noted in the thousands. He has authored and co-authored over 50 research articles indexed by SCI and Scopus databases, along with several books on topics including software engineering, IoT in smart cities, and programming. He has also contributed to the academic community by serving in roles such as session chair, technical chair, and keynote speaker at numerous international and national conferences. His work extends into practical applications, including innovative solutions for smart agriculture, smart tourism, and smart water management systems. Additionally, Dr. Mohapatra is involved in editorial activities and has been a guest editor for special issues on topics like fault-tolerant approaches for IoT integrated smart cities.
publications: Contributed as Resource Person in AICTE Training And Learning (ATAL) Academy Online Elementary FDP on ” Internet of Things(IoT) in Smart Cities” from 20/09/2021 to 24/09/2021 at Kongunadu College of Engineering and Technology.
Session chair for ICCSEA’22, India.
Technical Chair for AIARS-2022, Bristol, UK.
Workshop Chair for SEGRE-2023 at Changsha, China.
Session Chair for InC4 2023, at CHRIST DU, Bangalore, India, April 21-22, 2023.
Delivered an expert lecture on ”Criminal Data Analysis and Visualisation” at NFSU, Goa on 27-28 Jan 2023.

name: Indu
bio:
Ms. Indu is currently working as an Assistant Professor (I) in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. She has qualified the GATE and UGC-NET(JRF) examinations, reflecting her strong academic foundation and research aptitude.
She received the UGC-JRF (Government of India) Scholarship for her Ph.D. and has recently submitted her doctoral thesis at Guru Jambheshwar University of Science and Technology (GJUS&T), Hisar, Haryana, with research focused on unmanned aerial vehicles in wireless communication. She has published her research papers in SCI and Scopus-indexed journals and has presented her work at various international conferences.
She has over two years of teaching experience in the field of Computer Science and Engineering. She completed her M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering with Distinction from Banasthali Vidyapeeth, Rajasthan in 2014 and her B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering with Distinction from Vaish College of Engineering, Rohtak, Haryana in 2012.
Her areas of interest include wireless communication, ad-hoc networks, unmanned aerial vehicle communication, and emerging communication technologies. She is passionate about teaching, mentoring students, and pursuing research that bridges theoretical advancements with real-world applications in next-generation communication systems.
publications: Wireless Communications and Networking

name: Ipsita Paul
bio: Ms.Ipsita Paul is currently working as an Assistant Professor in School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneshwar, Odisha. She is also pursuing her PhD. in KIIT. She completed her M.Tech in CSE from KIIT. She also has industrial working experience in TCS, Hyderabad. She has been teaching various subjects for 6 years in KIIT which mainly include software engineering and big data. Her research area includes Image Processing and Deep Learning.

name: Jagannath Singh
bio: Jagannath Singh has completed Ph. D. from NIT Rourkela in the year 2016 in Software Engineering. Now, he is working as Assistant Professor in the School of   Computer Engineering, KIIT deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He has eight years of teaching experience. He earned a M. Tech. degree from NIT Rourkela in the year 2012. His is guiding two Ph. D. and two M. Tech. students in the field of Software Engineering. His research area include Software Engineering, Software Testing and Debugging, Artificial Neural Network, and Deep Learning.

name: Jasaswi Prasad Mohanty
bio: Jasaswi Prasad Mohanty received his M.Tech. degree in Computer Science from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar, India in 2006. He received his Ph.D degree in Computer Science & Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, India, in 2020. He has more than seventeen years of teaching and research experience. Currently, he is working as Associate Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed-to-be University, Bhubaneswar, India. His research interests include Wireless networks, Machine Learning, and Natural Language Processing. He has qualified GATE and UGC-NET examinations. He has been recognized as NPTEL Domain Scholar in Programming.

tab_details.Research Interests: Machine Learning, NLP

name: Jay Sarraf
bio: Dr. Jay Sarraf currently works as an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT University. With more than 7 years of experience supporting marketing and development to enhance internal processes for small firms, he is a multifaceted, self-starter, and trustworthy IT specialist. His research areas focus on the brain-computer interface and signal and image processing. Dr. Sarraf is also a passionate public speaker and motivator. Dr. Jay Sarraf has a strong commitment to social work. He thinks that working with the underprivileged population through socialist practises can bring about change. He adheres to the teachings of Dr. Achyuta Samanta, who seeks to end hunger and poverty by ensuring that everyone has access to education. In order to preserve, preach, and teach the philosophy of Art of Giving for the underprivileged community through technical, mental, and physical processes, Dr. Sarraf has organized social events involving his students and served as an influential activist for the social welfare of people. He also served as a Kickstarter for various welfare programmes.

name: Jayanti Dansana
bio: Dr. Jayanti Dansana has completed her PhD from KIIT, Deemed to be University in the year 2024.She has 20 years of experience in teaching and research. She is currently working as Assistant Professor in School of Computer Engineering. She has published around 30 number of papers in International Conferences; SCI and Scopus Indexed Journals. Her research area includes Privacy preserving data mining, Machine Learning, Big Data. Her teaching expertise area includes Computer Network, Big Data, Data Mining, Machine Learning and Cloud Computing. She has guided undergraduate and post graduate students of the school in different projects and thesis. She has already supervised around fifteen post graduate students. She is also guiding PhD students in the above-mentioned research area. She has attended around 35 a faculty development program, seminar and workshop in national and International level also she has organized workshop and seminars in Computer Science Engineering subject area.

name: Jayashree Piri
bio: Dr. Jayashree Piri is currently working as an Associate Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. She has done M.E. in Information Technology from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, W.B., in the year 2012. Dr. Piri received her PhD award from IIIT Bhubaneswar, Odisha. She has more than thirteen years of teaching experience. She has published many research publications in peer-reviewed journals such as Computers in Biology and Medicine, IEEE Access, Mathematics, Algorithms, etc. Dr. Piri also has done a patent under IP German in the year 2022. She has delivered presentations at many international conferences. Her area of research lies in Evolutionary computing, Pattern Recognition, Machine learning, and Medical data analysis.

tab_details.Research Interests: Evolutionary computing, Pattern Recognition, Machine Learning, and Medical data analysis

name: Jayeeta Chakraborty
bio: Jayeeta Chakraborty completed her Ph.D. with a thesis on “Quantitative Analysis of Gait Disorder using Machine Learning Techniques” from the department of Computer Science and Engineering in National Institute of Technology, Rourkela. She received her Master's degree from National Institute of Technology, Kurukshetra in the year 2017. Her current research interests include human gait analysis, pattern recognition, signal and image processing as well as data mining, recommendation systems, and semantic web. She has authored the book ``Modern Methods for Affordable Clinical Gait Analysis: Theories and Applications in Healthcare Systems''. She also has publications in reputed journals and international conferences. You can read more about her works from https://jayeetachakrabrty.blogspot.com/

name: Joy Dutta
bio: Dr. Joy Dutta is presently working as an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, Bhubaneswar, Orissa, India. He holds a BSc degree in Physics (Honours), followed by Post BSc BTech and MTech in Computer Science & Engineering from Calcutta University. He is a recipient of Government of India’s prestigious full-time Research Fellowship, viz., “Visvesvaraya PhD Fellowship” of Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY) for pursuing his full-time research from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University and has received his PhD (Engg.) Degree in February 2022. Dr. Dutta has the exposure of working in both the industry as well as in academia. In the initial days, he has worked as a Guest Faculty in the Netaji Subhash Engineering College and afterwards, he has also worked in the Sister Nivedita University, under Techno India Group, Kolkata, WB, India. He has also worked in the IT industry as a Software Engineer at Egnaro Company, at High-tech city, Hyderabad, India on several cutting edge technologies. Along with these, he is an active researcher in the field of IoT and related applications for social good. He has rich experience in the domain of Cloud Computing, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Data Analytics and Smart City based applications for social good. During his PhD tenure, he has pursued his research under the guidance of Professor (Dr.) Sarbani Roy of Department of Computer Science & Engineering, Jadavpur University. He is a member of IEEE and till date published several research papers in different renowned international conferences, journals and also written multiple book chapters for the global research audience.

tab_details.Research Interests: IoT, Cloud Computing, Data Analytics, Machine Learning, Smart City
tab_details.Awards & Honours: Visvesvaraya PhD Fellowship, MeitY, Government of India

name: Junali Jasmine Jena
bio: Dr. Junali Jasmine Jena has above 5 years of experience in teaching under-graduate and post-graduate students in the field of Computer Science and Information technology. She has graduated from Parala Maharaja Engg. College, Berhampur, Odisha (govt. funded institution) and did her Masters from VSSUT, Burla, Odisha(govt. funded university). She completed her Ph.D. in the area of Evolutionary Algorithms with 7 SCI publications. Her research area includes machine learning, soft computing methods for pattern recognition, evolutionary algorithms for optimization problems and data Analysis. Currently she is working as an Assistant Professor in School of Computer Engineering, KIIT(Deemed to be University), Bhubaneswar.

name: Jyotiprakash Mishra
bio: Jyotiprakash graduated from the prestigious BITS - Pilani with a degree in BE (Computer Science) in 2010. After serving as a Senior Member of Technical Staff with Oracle for 4 years, he went on to pursue his MS (Computer Science) from one of the world's topmost universities, the University of Wisconsin - Madison (USA) with a full scholarship. After graduating from there in 2016, he worked for Epic (the world's leading medical software company) in the US for 2 years as a Software Developer and later got promoted to a Software Development Manager. In 2020, he decided to leave the US to come back to India. Overall, he has more than 10 years of industry experience. He joined KIIT as an Assistant Professor (II) in September 2020. His research interests include Operating Systems, Computer Architecture, Embedded Systems, and Machine Learning. He teaches Operating Systems and Computer Architecture to undergraduate students here. He shares his lectures on his YouTube channel for the benefit of students and the Computer Science community overall.

tab_details.Research Interests: Operating SystemsComputer ArchitectureInformation SecurityMachine Learning

name: Jyotiranjan Swain
bio: Dr. Jyotiranjan Swain  earned his Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from the National Institute of Technology, Rourkela. He specializes in Digital Microfluidic Biochips (DMFB), focusing on intelligent droplet routing, machine learning, and swarm intelligence techniques for biomedical applications. His research aims to enhance the efficiency and reliability of DMFB-based point-of-care diagnostic systems. His long-term goal is to develop adaptive biochip systems for personalized medicine and real-time healthcare solutions.

tab_details.Research Interests: Digital Microfluidic BiochipsHealthcare DevicesCyber Physical SystemsMachine Learning

name: Krishna Chakravarty
bio:
She is an accomplished Information Technology (IT) professional with extensive experience working in India, USA and UK in providing services for Fortune 500 clients as well as having a deep understanding of the needs of IT in the industry. She is Silver Medallist from IIT Mumbai and started her career in academics in 2017 after serving around 15 years in IT industry. She is currently doing PhD in software engineering , to explore the boundary where industry practice meets the academia.
She is currently teaching the C/C++ programming , Software Engineering, Object Oriented System Development, Enterprise Resource Planning, Management Information System.
She has published research paper on bitcoin analysis. Her current research is going in agile process of software engineering.

name: Kumar Surjeet Chaudhury
bio: Dr. Kumar Surjeet Chaudhury is working as an Assistant Professor at School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He has received his B.E. degree in Computer Science & Engineering from Utkal University, Odisha in 2001, M.E. degree in Computer Science & Engineering from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, West Bengal in 2008 and Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from F.M. University, Balasore, Odisha in 2022. He has more than 19 years of teaching experience with number of publications in reputed & peer reviewed Journals. Additionally, he adds more than four years of industry expertise from his work as a Senior Development Consultant at INTEC BILLING. His main areas of interest in study include cloud computing and data analytics, with machine learning, deep learning and image processing as a persistent secondary interest. Apart from teaching he holds many administrative positions in the University like Hostel Superintendent. He is a life member of ISTE.

name: Kunal Anand
bio: Mr. Kunal Anand, received his Master's in Information and Communication Technology from IIT Kharagpur, India. At present, Mr. Anand is pursuing Ph.D. from Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He has more than 12 yrs. of teaching experience and recently he has joined as Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Engineering at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. At UG level, he has taught courses like Programming in C, Data Structure using C, OOP with C++, Database Management Systems, Operating Systems, Computer Networks, Software Engineering, Software Testing, and Software Project Management. His research areas include Software Testing, Speech Processing, and Machine Learning. He is an associate member of Institute of Engineers.

name: Madhabananda Das
bio: Dr. Madhabananda Das is working as a Senior Professor in the School of Computer Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha with 44 years of working experience which includes 29 years of teaching and research experiences and 15 years of industry experience. He holds a PhD degree in Computer Science and Engineering (KIIT University), and M. Sc. (Engineering) in Electronics Systems and Communication (Sambalpur University) and PGDBM (Xavier Institute of Management) degrees. He was a faculty member at the University College of Engineering, Burla in the Department of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering from 1981 to 1987. He was with the Orissa State Electronics Development Corporation Limited (an Odisha State Government Undertaking) from 1987 to 2002. His research interests include Artificial Intelligence, Soft Computing and Machine Learning. He has published or contributed more than 40 research papers in referred journals and conferences.

He is pursuing his Ph.D. from KIIT Deemed to be University. He has an experience of more than 18 years in academia and 7 years in research. He has also served as the organizing committees members of various conferences and workshop. His area of research includes Cloud Computing, Data Mining, Soft Computing and Internet and Web Technology.  He is a member of IAENG, UACEE and life member of ISTE, CSI and ISCA.

name: Minakhi Rout
bio: Dr. Minakhi Rout is an Associate Professor in the School of Computer Engineering at KIIT University. She has over 20+ years of experience in teaching and research across reputed institutions in Odisha and Hyderabad. She completed her B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering from KIIT University in 2005, followed by an M.Tech from ITER, Siksha 'O' Anusandhan University in 2009. She later pursued her Ph.D. in Computational Finance at Siksha 'O' Anusandhan University and completed in 2015. Dr. Rout has published 80+ research papers in reputed journals and international conferences. she has an h-index of 17 and an i10-index of 23, indicating a strong research impact. Her research interests include Soft Computing, Evolutionary Computing, Data Mining, and Computational Finance. She has guided 6 Ph.D. Scholars, 15 M.Tech. Scholars and several B.Tech students in various research areas. Her contributions to machine learning and deep learning applications, particularly in financial forecasting and medical imaging, have been widely recognized.

tab_details.Research Interests: 1. Soft Computing, Evolutionary Computing 2. Data Mining, and Computational Finance 3. Image analysis

name: Monideepa Roy
bio: Dr. Monideepa Roy has been working as an Associate Professor at KIIT Deemed University, Bhubaneswar since the last 11 years. She did her Bachelors & Masters in Mathematics from IIT Kharagpur, and her PhD in CSE from Jadavpur University. Her areas of interest include Remote Healthcare, Mobile Computing, Cognitive WSNs, Remote Sensing, Machine Learning, Recommender Systems, Sparse Approximations,and Artificial Neural Networks. She has successfully completed a 5 year project under MeiTy as well several other short term projects. At present she has seven research scholars working with her in the above areas and two more have successfully defended their theses under her guidance. She has several publications in reputed conferences and journals. She has been the Organizing Chair of the first two editions of the International Conference on Computational Intelligence and Networks CINE 2015 and 2016, ICMC 2019 and has organised several workshops and seminars She also has several book chapter publications as well as an edited book under Taylor and Francis.

name: Murari Mandal
bio: I am an Asst. Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Bhubaneshwar. I lead the RespAI Lab where we focus on research in LLMs, VLMs, AI Safety, AI Regulation, Model Editing, Machine Unlearning. My research has been published in ICML, KDD, AAAI, ACM MM, CVPR. My pioneering works had significant impact in the field of machine unlearning with 700+ citations. Our works Fast Unlearning [TNNLS], Zero-shot Unlearning [TIFS], and Bad Teacher [AAAI] are among top 10 highly cited papers in the field of machine unlearning. I regularly serve as a Reviewer to NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AAAI, CVPR, ICCV, and ECCV. Indexed in CSRankings. I am also part of the BrainX AI research community actively working on AI in Healthcare. Earlier, I was a PostDoc Fellow at National University of Singapore (NUS) where I worked with Prof. Mohan Kankanhalli. Long time back, I graduated in 2011 with a Bachelors in Computer Science from BITS, Pilani.

name: Partha Sarathi Paul
bio: "Hello, my name is Partha Sarathi Paul. I have been a PhD Scholar in the Department of Computer Science & Engineering at the National Institute of Technology Durgapur, India since February 2014 and have completed my PhD finally on 2nd February 2021. After this I have worked as a Post-Doctoral Researcher in a Sponsored Research Project Position at Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, India till the end of December 2021. I also have worked in a Sponsored Research Project Position at Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology Delhi in the capacity of a Research Assistant in between my thesis submission and its defense. I completed my Master of Technology in Computer Science [M. Tech. (CS)] at Indian Statistical Institute, India, in the year of 2003. I earned my Master’s degree in Pure Mathematics in the year 2000 and a Bachelor’s degree with Honors in Mathematics in 1998, both at the University of Calcutta, India. My areas of interest are in Mobile and Pervasive Networking Systems, Networking Systems and Their Applications, Disaster Management, and Human-Computer Interaction. My current research focuses on socio-mobile applications and mobile affective computing. I have made research publications in eminent, SCI-indexed, peer-reviewed journals, including the Journal of Network and Computer Applications (Impact Factor: 5.570), Ad Hoc Networks (Impact Factor: 3.643), and Scientometrics (Impact Factor: 2.867). I have also published papers in premier conferences and Workshops, including MobileHCI, PerCom (WiP), MobiCom CHANTS, COMSNETS, etc. I have also published a few book chapters with different national/international publishers. Before joining my PhD program in 2014, I was in the service of Teaching in Technical Institutions, had served three Institutions as Assistant Professor in Computer Science & Engineering for more than ten years.

tab_details.Research Interests: Networking Systems & Applications, Human-Computer Interaction, Mobile Affective Computing, Socio-Mobile Applications, Scholarly Network Analysis, etc.

name: Pinaki Sankar Chatterjee
bio:
Pinaki Sankar Chatterjee received his B.Tech degree in Information Technology from B.P.U.T, Orissa, India,  his M.Tech degree in Computer Science from IIT Kharagpur, West Bengal, India, and his PhD degree in Computer Science from KIIT Deemed-to-be University Bhubaneswar, India. He is a member of IET and Indian Science Congress. He has published
numbers of research papers in peer-reviewed international journals and conferences. His areas of interest include WSN, CWSN, NLP, IoT.

name: Prabhu Prasad Dev
bio: Mr. Prabhu Prasad Dev is working as a Assistant Professor in School of Computer Engineering , KIIT, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He received his M. Tech degree in Computer Science and Engineering from KIIT, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He is currently pursuing Ph.D in National Institute of Industrial Technology(NIT),Calicut. He teaches Formal Languages and Automata Theory, Data Structures, Design and Analysis of Algorithms and Cryptography. His research areas of interest include Machine Learning, Soft Computing, Deep Learning and Hyperspectral Image Processing.

name: Pradeep Kandula
bio: Pradeep Kandula holds master degree in computer science from prestigious IIT Kharagpur (W.B). He completed his Master of Computer Application from Sri Kottam Tulasi Reddy Memory College of Engineering ( affiliated to JNTU). He is working in KIIT University (Deemed-to-be-University) as Assistant Professor since 6th June, 2012 in Bhubaneswar, Odisha.

name: Pradeep Kumar Mallick
bio: Dr. Pradeep Kumar Mallick is a Senior Associate Professor in the School of Computer Engineering and the Associate Dean (IPR) at KIIT Deemed to be University, Odisha, India. Since January 2021, he has also been serving as a collaborating Research Professor at Baekseok University, South Korea. In addition, he currently holds the position of Vice-Chair of the IEEE Computer Society, Bhubaneswar Section. Earlier, he served as Professor and Head of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Vignana Bharathi Institute of Technology, Hyderabad.Dr. Mallick obtained his Post-Doctoral Fellowship from Kongju National University, South Korea, his Ph.D. from Siksha ‘O’ Anusandhan University, his M.Tech. (CSE) from Biju Patnaik University of Technology (BPUT), and his MCA from Fakir Mohan University. His research interests include Data Mining, Image Processing, Soft Computing, and Machine Learning.He has authored more than 190 research papers, 20 edited books, and one textbook. He also holds 14 granted international patents and 17 published national patents and has successfully completed two international consultancy research projects. Dr. Mallick serves as an Editorial Board Member of the Korean Convergence Society for SMB and as a Guest Editor for reputed international journals published by Elsevier, Springer Nature, SAGE, and Inderscience.

name: Prasant Kumar Pattnaik
bio: Dr. Prasant Kumar Pattnaik, Ph.D (Computer Science), Fellow IETE, Senior Member IEEE is a Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed University, Bhubaneswar. He has more than a decade of teaching and research experience. Dr. Pattnaik has published numbers of Research Papers in peer-reviewed International Journals and Conferences. He also published many edited book volumes in Springer ,IGI Global and Wiley Publication and He has co-authored the popular Computer Science and Engineering text books ,“Fundamental of Mobile Computing”,PHI and “Cloud Computing Solutions: Architecture, Data Storage, Implementation and Security”, John Wiley & Sons Inc. His areas of interest include Mobile Computing, Cloud Computing, Cyber Security, Intelligent Systems and Brain Computer Interface.
publications: Educational Qualification Research Interests Cloud Computing, Mobile Computing and Wireless Sensor Networks, Brain Computer Interface Awards & Honours

name: Prasenjit Maiti
bio: Prasenjit Maiti is an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT DU, Bhubaneswar, India. He received his B.Tech (Computer Science and Engineering) in 2008 from the Maulana Abul Kalam Azad University of Technology (Formerly known as West Bengal University of Technology ), and M.Tech ( Information Technology) in 2013 under Dr. Rajat Subhra Chakraborty from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Kharagpur, West Bengal, India. Currently, he is pursuing a Ph.D. degree in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at the National Institute of Technology (NIT), Rourkela, India, under Dr. Bibhudatta Sahoo and Professor Ashok Kumar Turuk. The prestigious research fellowship award, viz., “Visvesvaraya Ph.D. Fellowship,” was awarded for his full-time research under the Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY), Government of India. His teaching experience spanned more than six years. His current research interests include Fog Computing, Cloud Computing. He has published his work in the various high-impact journal reputed conferences and received the best paper award for his work and two books in the domain of Fog Computing. Currently, he is a member of the Indian Society for Technical Education (ISTE) and the International Association of Engineers (IAENG).
publications: 1. Best Paper Award in the Session High Performance Computing, International Conference on Emerging Technologies in Data Mining and Information Security (IEMIS), (Springer), Kolkata, West Bengal, India, 2018.

name: Pratyusa Mukherjee
bio: Pratyusa Mukherjee is currently working as an Assistant Professor in School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University (KIIT), Bhubaneshwar, Odisha. She was awarded her Doctor of Philosophy from KIIT in 2022. She completed her M.Tech in Information Technology from Indian Institute of Engineering Science and Technology (IIEST), Shibpur. She stood fifth in entire Maharashtra, first in Vidarbha Region and first in Nagpur City in her CBSE X Board Examinations. Her research area includes Information Technology, Blockchain Technology and Soft Computing. Cryptography, Network Security, Cyber Security, Design and Analysis of Algorithms are subjects of her interest.

tab_details.Research Interests: 1. Information Security 2. Blockchain Technology
tab_details.Administrative Responsibility: FIC In-charge Website & Social Media Management

name: Priyanka Panigrahi
bio: Priyanka Panigrahi has successfully defended her PhD titled “Security Verification of Compiler Optimizations: An Information Flow Perspective” in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT Guwahati in April 2024. Her research interests include compiler security, security vulnerability detection, program analysis, and security verification. She has won the Qualcomm Innovation Fellowship (QIF), India, 2022. She is a member of IEEE.

tab_details.Research Interests: compiler security, security vulnerability detection, program analysis, and security verification
tab_details.Awards & Honours: Winner of Qualcomm Innovation Fellowship India 2022

name: Priyanka Roy
bio: Priyanka Roy is an Assistant Professor in School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology(KIIT) University, Bhubaneswar, India. She received her M.Tech degree in CSE from University of Calcutta. She is pursuing PhD in Indian Institute of Technology(Indian School of Mines) Dhanbad, India under the supervision of Dr. Soumen Bag. Her research domain of interest includes Handwritten document image analysis, Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning. In addition to the academic learning, she has more than three years experience of project titled ""Design and Implementation of Multiple Strategies to Identify Handwritten Forgery Activities in Legal Documents"", sponsored by SERB, Govt. of India. Early in her professional career, she taught CSE in Gargi Memorial Institute of Technology(GMIT), Kolkata, India for six months.

tab_details.Research Interests: Digital image processing, Handwritten document image processing, Pattern recognition, Machine learning

name: Pushkar Kishore
bio: Mr. Pushkar Kishore is an esteemed faculty member at KIIT (Deemed to be) University, Bhubaneswar. He earned his B.Tech. degree in Information Technology from Muzaffarpur Institute of Technology, Bihar in 2014, and his MTech. degree in Software Engineering from National Institute of Technology, Rourkela, Odisha in 2017. His Ph.D. is ongoing at National Institute of Technology Rourkela, Odisha, India. He has made significant contributions to the field of computer science, with 9 research papers in core conferences and Q1 journals. Apart from that, he published 11 research papers and got 1 product patent granted by Government of India in 2021. He served as director for Startup named Drivomate Technologies Private Limited for around 4 years. He brings startup experience, thereby enriching the learning experience for his students. His research interests are Software Security, Malware Analysis, Vulnerability Analysis, Real-Time Operating System and IoT security. Currently, as an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT (Deemed to be) University, Mr. Pushkar continues to inspire and guide students and colleagues alike with his dedication to advancing knowledge and fostering innovation in the field of computer engineering.

name: Raghunath Dey
bio: Dr. Raghunath Dey is currently working as an Assistant Professor in School of Computer Engineering Department, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He has done M.E. in Information Technology from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, W.B. in the year 2012. Dr. Dey received his PhD award from IIIT Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He has more than fourteen years of teaching experience. He has published many research publications in peer-reviewed journals such as Multimedia Tools and Applications, ACM Transactions on Asian and Low-Resource Language Information Processing, etc. Dr. Dey also has done a patent under IP Australia in the year 2021. He has delivered presentations at many international conferences and technical institutions. His area of research lies in Pattern Recognition, Machine Learning, and Offline Handwritten Character Recognition.

name: Rajat Kumar Behera
bio: Rajat Behera joined KIIT in July 2016 after spending 15 years in IT Industry. Since coming to KIIT, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, he has served in the School of Computer Engineering. He did graduation from VSSUT with specialization in Computer Science & Engineering, completed M.Tech from IIT Delhi with specialization in Mathematical Computer Science and PGDM from IMT CDL Ghaziabad with specialization in Marketing and pursuing PhD from IIM Ranchi in Information Systems. His research interests include Data Science, Software Engineering and Blockchain.

name: Rajdeep Chatterjee
bio: Rajdeep Chatterjee received his Bachelor of Engineering in Computer Science and Engineering from The University of Burdwan in 2008. He completed both his Master of Technology and Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from KIIT Deemed to be University in 2011 and 2020, respectively. He received an MHRD (Now, Ministry of Education, Govt. of India) scholarship in his masters for possessing All India Rank 1410 in GATE-2008. He started his professional career as Project Linked Person at Machine Intelligence Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata. He is currently working as an Associate Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. Besides, he is associated as an expert member in the Cognitive Systems and Cybernetics Research Lab., MIU, ISI Kolkata, India. He is also one of the founding members of the international conference series on Computational Intelligence & Networks (http://www.cineconf.org). He has published research articles in many reputed international conferences and journals. He is a regular reviewer of various reputed journals such as Medical & Biological Eng. & Computing (SCI-E, IF: 2.602), IEEE Transactions on Biomedical Engineering (SCI-E, IF: 4.538), IEEE Journal of Biomedical and Health Informatics (SCI-E, IF: 5.223), Computers in Biology and Medicine (SCI-E, IF: 4.589), IEEE Transactions on Emerging Topics in Computational Intelligence (Scopus, IF: 8.28), Evolutionary Intelligence (Scopus, DBLP), etc. His research areas include Brain-Computer Interface, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Computer Vision.

name: Rakesh Kumar Rai
bio:
Rakesh Rai is a dedicated researcher, educator, and data enthusiast with a strong technology, analytics, and computational neuroscience background. With a B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering from NIT Nagaland, he began his professional journey as a Data Analyst at IGL, where he spent three years deriving valuable insights from complex datasets. He works as an Assistant Professor in the CSE Department at KIIT University, Bhubaneswar. Alongside his academic role, he is pursuing a PhD in Computer Science at MNNIT Allahabad. His research focuses on Human Cognitive Behavior and Brain State Analysis using EEG signals, exploring how different physiological conditions influence brain activity. Key Achievements & Skills:
✔ PhD Scholar (MNNIT Allahabad)
✔ Honored to be selected for a PhD in Computer Science at the esteemed IIT Dhanbad (2022)
✔ GATE Qualified
✔ AIEEE 2012 – AIR GEN 25083
✔ Programming Proficiency: C, C++, Python With expertise spanning data science, neuroscience, and computational modeling, he is passionate about bridging the gap between technology and human cognition. He is always open to collaborations, discussions, and opportunities in AI-driven neuroscience and brain-computer interface (BCI) research."

tab_details.Research Interests: 1. Brain computer Interface 2. Human Computer Interaction 3. AI/ML
tab_details.Administrative Responsibility: Course Coordinator for PMLDL and Foundation of Block Chain Technology
tab_details.Awards & Honours: Sports Secretary of NIT Nagaland for the year 2013-2014.Publicity & Marketing Head of Techno-Cultural Fest of NIT Nagaland.Represented my college at Inter-NIT state level cricket tournament for two consecutive years.Cleared the cloud computing NPTEL exam with elite tag.Got selected for full time PhD program at IIT Dhanbad in CSE department.

name: Ranjita Kumari Dash
bio: Dr. Ranjita Kumari Dash  is currently working as an Assistant Professor (II) in School of Computer Engineering, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar. She did her Ph.D. at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, NIT Rourkela in 2018. She has a total experience of 19 years teaching at different Universities in India.  Her research interest lies in Advance Computer Architecture, Artificial Intelligence with Machine learning and Deep learning approaches.
publications: Research Interests Advance Computer Architecture, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning Memberships Reviewer in SummerSim Conference, Springsim Conference (ACM)

name: Rinku Datta Rakshit
bio: Rinku Datta Rakshit, presently working as an Associate professor at the School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. She completed her B.Tech (Information Technology) in 2005 from Jalpaiguri Government Engineering College, Jalpaiguri, West Bengal. She completed her M.Tech (Multimedia & Software Systems) in 2011 from National Institute of Technical Teachers’ Training & Research, Kolkata. She did her Ph.D (Computer Science and Engineering) in 2021 from National Institute of Technology Durgapur. She received Visvesvaraya fellowship for completion of her PhD under “Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronic & IT”, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India. She has more than 15 years of teaching experience. She is a Wipro Certified faculty. She worked as an organizing committee member, reviewer, and session chair in some international conferences. Her research area includes image processing, biometrics, and machine learning. Her publications include many SCI indexed journals, conferences and book chapters.

tab_details.Research Interests: Image Processing, Biometrics, and Machine Learning
